content: The practice of psychology involves more than the clinical treatment of mental illness. Although the media may perpetuate the view that all psychologists are healthcare professionals, or specialists who deal with deviant or non-normal behaviors, the majority of psychologists study and practice in diverse areas of human functioning other than clinical psychology. Psychology is the scientific study of human thought and behavior, all human behavior. It is a science with the same rigorous research standards as physics, chemistry, or biology. This book showcases a variety of applications of psychological science in the areas of health, law, sports, business, religion, and money. It is an outgrowth of the River Cities Industrial-Organizational Psychology Conference held at The University of Tennessee at Chattanooga, USA, in October 2008. The theme of the 2008 conference was “Applying Psychology to Everyday Life.” We hope the content of this volume enhances your awareness of the importance of applied psychology and that it motivates you to further explore its potential to impact our daily lives. Bart L. Weathington, PhD, is a UC Foundation Associate Professor of Psychology and coordinator of the Industrial-Organizational Psychology graduate program at The University of Tennessee at Chattanooga. He is an industrial-organizational and sport psychology researcher, teacher, and consultant on applied psychological issues. Christopher J. L. Cunningham, PhD, is a UC Foundation Associate Professor of Psychology at The University of Tennessee at Chattanooga. He is actively engaged in industrial-organizational and occupational health psychology research, teaching, and consulting. Brian J. O’Leary, PhD, is the Head of the Department of Psychology at the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga. In addition to his teaching and administrative responsibilities, he consults for local, regional and international organizations, and performs research on justice in the workplace. Michael D. Biderman, PhD, is Salem Carpet Professor of Psychology at The University of Tennessee at Chattanooga. In addition to teaching undergraduate and graduate statistics, he is engaged in research on the use of personality tests in selection and assessment. While virologists predict the next pandemic, little attention has been paid to the psychological factors that influence the spread of infection, emotional distress, and social disruption. This book is the first comprehensive analysis of the psychology of pandemics. The Story Cookbook is a comprehensive collection of over 80 story-based activities. This easy-to-follow guide provides a treasure trove of techniques to apply and adapt. It is a must-read for consultants, educators, and leaders using storytelling for positive change. This book explores the human psyche (‘soul’) and its usefulness in a techno-scientific revolution that is often blind to its subject: the human being. It makes a strong intellectual case for the soul by examining consciousness, synchronicity, suffering, and death. Fractal dynamics provide a tool for understanding complexity. This book brings experts together to reconcile dichotomies like mind-brain and subjective-objective, bringing subjective experience into a scientific framework. What can we do about children who withdraw from loving care, or parents lost in the hurts of their own childhood? This book gathers 25 stories from 41 years in infant mental health, revealing how our earliest attachment experiences support or confound our later development. Synthesizing decades of research, this book explores innovations in teaching to enrich the lives of children. It offers practical strategies for educators and parents based on whole child development, creativity, and the power of play. Essential reading. This essential guide to the youth transgender crisis argues social contagion is a key factor in the upsurge. It exposes the perils of medicalization—from puberty blockers to h...
summary: Psikologi bukan hanya bidang yang fokus pada pengobatan gangguan mental, tetapi juga diterapkan dalam berbagai aspek kehidupan sehari-hari, seperti kesehatan, hukum, olahraga, bisnis, agama, dan keuangan. Artikel ini menekankan bahwa psikologi sebagai ilmu pengetahuan tentang pikiran dan perilaku manusia memiliki standar penelitian yang sama ketatnya dengan ilmu fisika, kimia, atau biologi. Dalam konteks praktis, psikologi membantu memahami dan memperbaiki fungsi manusia secara menyeluruh. Konferensi "Applied Psychology to Everyday Life" di University of Tennessee at Chattanooga tahun 2008 menyoroti potensi psikologi dalam kehidupan sehari-hari. Penulis, termasuk Bart L. Weathington, Christopher J. L. Cunningham, dan Brian J. O’Leary, menekankan pentingnya psikologi dalam bidang industri, organisasi, kesehatan kerja, dan keadilan di tempat kerja. Mereka juga menekankan bahwa psikologi dapat menjadi alat untuk memperbaiki kualitas hidup, meningkatkan produktivitas, dan memperkuat keberlanjutan dalam kehidupan sosial dan profesional. Dengan memahami prinsip-prinsip psikologi, individu dapat mengambil keputusan yang lebih bijak, mengelola stres, dan membangun hubungan yang sehat. Artikel ini memperkuat pemahaman bahwa psikologi adalah ilmu yang relevan dan bermanfaat dalam berbagai bidang, termasuk kehidupan beragama, di mana tazkiyatun nufus dan keseimbangan batin dapat diterapkan secara ilmiah. Dengan demikian, psikologi bukan hanya ilmu klinis, tetapi juga alat untuk membangun kehidupan yang lebih sehat dan bermakna.
